title: Nivel Codiciado talks Cocaine, Making Songs For Traffickers, Tony Loya Beef & More
description:
-----
00:00 Intro
2:10 - Going viral after their last appearance on No Jumper
4:05 - Everyone in the group is from Mexico. Meeting in high school. Starting out making more traditional Mexican music
7:10 - Blowing up in 2019 after dropping “Mi gusto mi dinero
10:50 - Addressing the claims that they stole their name from another group
12:20 - Explaining the fallout with Tony Loya over his ex appearing in their music video. Still open to working together in the future
16:30 - Being excited for the upcoming collab with Legado 7
18:12 - Recording songs with Joe Mejia and Clave Especial in the same day
19:42 - Turning down a $1M contract. Not planning on signing with a label anytime soon
25:00 - Difficulties in dealing with promoters. DoKnow remembers how he avoided getting in the middle of their money problems after seeing not getting paid on tour
31:27 - Why c*ke is more accepted in Mexican culture
36:53 - Their bandmate Abeltio is marrying his sister. Being mad at first
39:35 - New album coming and collabs with Legado 7, Joe Mejia and Clave Especial

-----
